page.title: 05BASSETT 1
page.content: (landscape) The land was sloping slightly with some more obvious hills such as in the Red Hill area. (housing) The area is a suburban, residential part of Southampton, largely owner-occupied, and is a network of roads with a high percentage of cul-de-sacs. This was done to stop passing traffic. The housing was of all types, detached, semi-detached, terraced and bungalows, though there was a concentration of each type in separate parts of the area. (shops) There was a small parade of shops numbering about 15 at the junction of two of the main roads. The shops included food shops, and a bank.
